subject: Science
title: The Voyager Missions
description: A fast breakdown of The Voyager Missions for builders.

hook.text: In 1977, NASA launched two spacecraft on a one-way trip to the edge of the solar system.

buildup.text: Voyager 1 and 2 used gravity assists to visit Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune.

discovery.text: They sent back the first close-up images of those worlds and their moons.

twist.text: Both carry a Golden Record with sounds and images of Earth â€” a message to aliens.

climax.text: Voyager 1 crossed into interstellar space in 2012 â€” the first human-made object to do so.

punchline.text: Two spacecraft launched in 1977 are still phoning home from beyond.

quiz.question: What milestone did Voyager 1 achieve in 2012?
